poem:
Raindrops and Reflections

In the city's wet embrace,  
pavement mirrors the gray,  
skies spill silver stories—  
chaos as a lens' muse.  
Drops dance on glass panes,  
while under umbrellas,  
faces catch fleeting frames,  
silent cinema in each step,  
a world of whispers,  
where every shimmer,  
a photograph, yet  
unshot, but seen.
